page.title: 09FLORA AND FAUNA, STRENSHAM
page.content: This section of the Avon Valley has suffered, in some respects, from intensive farming but{foxes, } {badgers,stoats, hares and rabbits}are still present in the area. Less welcome is the influx of{mink.} Among the insect population, there is a wide range of varieties of{dragonfly}and {damselfly. } The{Marsh Warbler}is breeding further up the river than formerly and its nesting sites are under constant supervision.{Redshanks}are also again in the area. The{Curlew}is becoming a frequent visitor but, as yet, has not bred. Though tree cover has been severely reduced by Dutch Elm disease,there are some small copses of ash and hornbeam. The common land near Woodmancote was previously a salt works and has some unusual plants, e.g.{Sea Club Rush.}
